title: Asset Forfeiture Funds (Santa Ana Police Department)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Asset Forfeiture Funds (Santa Ana Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

- Any accounting records or statistics on seized real estate, vehicles, firearms, funds in bank accounts, and seizures made by the department, as well as seizures made by federal authorities where the department receives a share under the MOUs the department has in place with numerous agencies describing how assets are to be divided.

- Records and data that outlines what was purchased using money from the fund, including dates, descriptions, and total spent. 

- Any annual reports produced civil asset forfeiture program.

- Documents showing the balance of any funds currently in the department Civil Asset Forfeiture fund.

-A list of all items seized through civil asset forfeiture and retained for use by the department

- Sales of non-monetary assets, receipts of sale for vehicles, or the destruction of other non-monetary assets

-Please also include any information relating to contested seizures. This request does not include court documents for individual forfeiture cases.
 
The period for this request is for the last 10 years.

Preferably released in .CSV form when possible

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joey Scott

title: Email Metadata

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Email Metadata
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

The following metadata for emails sent by all accounts operated by the mayor's office between the dates of December 2, 2024 and December 10, 2024:
- Sender
- Recipient (To, CC, BCC)
- Date and time sent
- Subject

As this is a request for metadata, please do not include the email body in the returned records.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

communications.subject: City of Seattle Public Records Request Center - Invoice Ready :: C208686-121624
communications.communication:
Dear Rose Terse, 
 
Records in response to your public disclosure request C208686-121624 received on December 16, 2024 are now available. The cost for the records is as follows: 
 
Invoice Number: INV25-C208686-1 
Total: $1.25 
 
To pay online, please follow these steps: 
 Please note that you will need to disable any pop-up blockers to make a payment using the system. 
 
  * Navigate to the Public Records Request Center. 
  * Select 'My Records Request Center'. 
  * Select 'View My Requests'. You may be asked to login. 
  * Find this request: C208686-121624. 
  * Select the 'View Invoices' button. 
 
  * Opens a pop-up window showing your invoice: INV25-C208686-1. 
  * Click on the invoice and then the 'Pay Now' button. 
  * Continue processing your payment. 
  * Select 'Done'. 
  * Once the payment process is done, you are returned to the Public Records Request Center. 
  * After your payment is successful you will receive an email from our payments center. 
Once your payment has been approved, we will send you an email with instructions on how to download your records. Note that City staff must manually upload records. Records will be available one to two business days after payment. 
 
Please let your public disclosure officer (PDO) know if you are unable to pay online; your PDO will work with you on alternative ways to make your payment. 
 
You have 30 days from today's date to pay for your records. If the City does not receive your payment within this time period, your request will be considered abandoned, and you will need to submit a new request. 
 Please add seattle@mycusthelp.net to your E-mail contacts/address book to ensure delivery of the record center E-mails to your Inbox. (mailto:seattle@mycusthelp.net) 
This is an auto-generated email and has originated from an unmonitored email account. Please DO NOT REPLY.

title: Cadet Military Duty and Other Schedule/Matrix

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Cadet Military Duty and Other Schedule/Matrix
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

TO AVOID UNNECESSARY DELAYS IN PROCESSING, I REQUEST NOW THAT ANY ESTIMATED COST TO FILL MY REQUEST BE PROVIDED.

YOU DO NOT NEED TO ASK ME IF I WANT YOU TO PREPARE A COST ESTIMATE IF THERE IS ONE

For the 2023 - 24 and current academic year to date copies of the Corps weekly training schedule/matrix/duty schedules and or other records showing all military and other duty for the Corps of Cadets. A copy of one such record is attached. Based on my knowledge and belief this record consists of an excel spreadsheet including, at a minimum tabs covering  Master Schedule, Information Annex, Activities Annex, Athletics Annex.

I note these documents are in electrnic format (Word, Excel, etc.) and should be provided in that format. Further, being stored in electronic format I anticipate they are readily accessible and so do not warrant a processing delay or search fees.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Anonymous.

communications.subject: [External Message Added] Virginia Military Institute public records request #25-26
communications.communication:
Virginia Military Institute ************************************************************************ A message was sent to you regarding record request #25-26: After consultation with the individuals responsible for the information you requested, I have determined that the estimated cost of fulfilling your request is $108.26. As you may be aware, § 2.2-3704. F. of the Code of Virginia allows public bodies to charge for accessing, duplicating, supplying, redacting or searching for the requested records. This estimate reflects the following staff time: * * Deputy Commandant for Operations, Plans, and Training – 1.5 hours @ $50.11/hr. * Records related to Corps weekly training schedules * FOIA Officer - 0.5 hours @ $66.20/hr. * Review of responsive records Please let me know if you agree to the estimated cost. If you do, we will begin to fulfill the request and provide an invoice at the time any responsive records are produced. ************************************************************************ Questions about your request? Reply to this email or sign in to contact staff at Virginia Military Institute.

title: Physical Restraint: 11-01 Forms, January 2025

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: 11-01 Forms, January 2025
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Copies of the individual 11-01 forms from January 1, 2025 to January 31, 2025.

This request is made on behalf of The FOIA Bakery. Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Miriam Bhimani

communications.subject: Welcome to the FOIA Center!
communications.communication:
Thank you for registering with the CPS FOIA Center. Please log in to the FOIA Center to update any contact or password information and to track the progress of your request. 
 Your Login ID is:  181495-02464097@requests.muckrock.com If you did not submit your request through the Records Center but are receiving this e-mail, an account has been created for you where you can track and monitor the status of your request, and receive any documents in response to your request. If you have never used this system or cannot remember your password you may request a temporary password here: Request Temporary Password. (https://cps.mycusthelp.com/webapp/_rs/forgotpassword.aspx?) 
 
 
 
This is an auto-generated email and has originated from an unmonitored email account. Please DO NOT REPLY.

communications.subject: FOIA Request :: N016971-021625
communications.communication:
Dear Miriam: 
 
Thank you for your interest in Chicago Public Schools. Your FOIA request has been submitted. Your FOIA Center reference number for tracking purposes is: N016971-021625 
You have requested the following records: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Copies of the individual 11-01 forms from January 1, 2025 to January 31, 2025.

This request is made on behalf of The FOIA Bakery. Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Miriam Bhimani

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fchicago-public-schools-3121%252F11-01-forms-january-2025-181495%252F%253F&url_auth_token=AAATZ164Jy60iQjs6iHTUOyYGcc%3A1tjrYN%3A2j27WDLHUuHMsjpplOBgWnh0ESkINN6mAfXRyFUj4hs 
 
Chicago Public Schools (CPS) responds to all public records requests in accordance with the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq. 
Due to the volume and complexity of requests received in the normal course of business, CPS is extending the time for its initial response to your request by an additional 5 business days (to 10 business days total beginning on the first business day following receipt of the request) pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/3(e)(v) which allows for the examination and evaluation of the requested records by personnel to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of Illinois FOIA or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions. 
Upon the completion of a response, CPS will provide the first 50 pages to you at no charge.  If a response is more than 50 pages, a fee of 15¢ per page will be charged for each additional page. All applicable fees must be paid prior to the copying. CPS will inform you of any fees due if your paper response exceeds 50 pages. You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you’ll receive an email when your request has been completed. Thank you for using the CPS FOIA Center.

communications.subject: Non-Commercial FOIA Request :: N016971-021625
Non-Commercial FOIA Request :: N016971-021625
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 
March 3, 2025 Miriam Bhimani RE: Chicago Public Schools FOIA Request N016971-021625 Dear Miriam Bhimani: This letter is in reply to your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request seeking the following information: 
Copies of the individual 11-01 forms from January 1, 2025 to January 31, 2025. RESPONSE: Documents responsive to your FOIA request are available to download via the Chicago Public Schools FOIA Center. Please visit the following link and enter your username and password to access the records: http://cps.edu/About_CPS/Departments/Law/Pages/FOIARequest.aspx . Portions of the information have been redacted to protect identifiable student information included within the records. Pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7.5(r) in accordance with Illinois Student Records Act (ISSRA). ISSRA prohibits the disclosure of “school student records” and defines a “school student record” as “any writing or other recorded information concerning a student and by which a student may be individually identified, maintained by a school or at its direction or by an employee of a school, regardless of how or where the information is stored. 105 ILCS 10/(d): Release of a minor’s record may only be authorized by the parent or guardian in accordance with the Illinois student Records Act (105 ILCS 10/1 et seq.). To the extent you consider this a denial of your request, you have the right to challenge this response under 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a) by filing a request for review with the Public Access Counselor (PAC) at: Public Access Counselor; Office of the Attorney General; 500 South 2nd Street; Springfield, IL 62706 . You also have the right to seek judicial review of your denial by filing a lawsuit in the State circuit court, 5 ILCS 140/11. If you choose to file a Request for Review with the PAC, you must do so within 60 calendar days of the date of this denial letter. 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a). Please note that you must include a copy of your original FOIA request and this denial letter when filing a Request for Review with the PAC. Thank you for your request. Sincerely, Ana Diaz Freedom of Information Act Officer Chicago Public Schools

title: FOIA - Adams County Sheriff - COPS (TV Show) Contracts

communications.subject: Colorado Open Records Act Request: FOIA - Adams County Sheriff - COPS (TV Show) Contracts
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All copy of all contracts, purchase orders, MOUs, SOWs, and any other documents sufficient to show contractual obligations between Langley Productions (https://www.langleyproductions.com/) and your agency.

Please see the following news article, which includes statements from Adams County Sheriff Rick Reigenborn, for more information on the documents I am seeking via this request: https://www.9news.com/article/news/local/adams-county-sheriff-signs-deal-with-tv-show/73-a67d3e98-b21e-4883-b992-1ad43f9551a4

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

J Ader

title: Asset Forfeiture Funds (Anaheim Police Department)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Asset Forfeiture Funds (Anaheim Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

- Any accounting records or statistics on seized real estate, vehicles, firearms, funds in bank accounts, and seizures made by the department, as well as seizures made by federal authorities where the department receives a share under the MOUs the department has in place with numerous agencies describing how assets are to be divided.

- Records and data that outlines what was purchased using money from the fund, including dates, descriptions, and total spent. 

- Any annual reports produced civil asset forfeiture program.

- Documents showing the balance of any funds currently in the department Civil Asset Forfeiture fund.

-A list of all items seized through civil asset forfeiture and retained for use by the department

- Sales of non-monetary assets, receipts of sale for vehicles, or the destruction of other non-monetary assets

-Please also include any information relating to contested seizures. This request does not include court documents for individual forfeiture cases.
 
The period for this request is for the last 10 years.

Preferably released in .CSV form when possible

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joey Scott

communications.subject: [External Message Added] Anaheim Police Department public records request #25-801
communications.communication:
Anaheim Police Department ************************************************************************ A message was sent to you regarding record request #25-801: Good Afternoon: The Anaheim Police Department ("APD") is in receipt of your recent Public Records Act ("PRA"). Please note that the APD does not possess records containing the exact information you have requested, and the APD has no duty to create such a record. (Haynie v. Superior Court, 26 Cal.4th 1061(2001.) Certain records may be redacted or withheld as they are subjection to exemptions to the Public Records Act including, without limitation, the following: * Financial information is exempt from disclosure (Gov. Code §§ 7925.005, 7470, 7471 and 7473); • Documents reflecting police techniques or security procedures are expressly exempt from disclosure pursuant to Government Code §7923.600, et seq.; • The records contain personal contact information (Gov. Code §7922.000); and/or • The records are subject to the public interest exemption (Gov. Code §7922.000). Without waiving, and subject to, the foregoing exemptions, the APD has identified records responsive to your request. Such records are being made available to you within this portal. Thank you. ************************************************************************ Questions about your request? Reply to this email or sign in to contact staff at Anaheim Police Department.

title: Governance: Email Logs, CPS Board Member Debby Pope, January 2025

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Board Governance: Debby Pope Emails, January 2025
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

A log of all emails to/from the CPS Board Member, Debby Pope, from January 1, 2025 - January 31, 2025.

1. Please search all CPS email accounts as well as personal accounts used for public business. The log should include but not be limited to: sender, recipient(s), date and time, subject line, and attachment.

This request is made on behalf of The FOIA Bakery. Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Miriam Bhimani

Chicago Public Schools (CPS) responds to all public records requests in accordance with the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq. 
Due to the volume and complexity of requests received in the normal course of business, CPS is extending the time for its initial response to your request by an additional 5 business days (to 10 business days total beginning on the first business day following receipt of the request) pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/3(e)(v) which allows for the examination and evaluation of the requested records by personnel to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of Illinois FOIA or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions. 
Upon the completion of a response, CPS will provide the first 50 pages to you at no charge.  If a response is more than 50 pages, a fee of 15¢ per page will be charged for each additional page. All applicable fees must be paid prior to the copying. CPS will inform you of any fees due if your paper response exceeds 50 pages. You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you’ll receive an email when your request has been completed. Thank you for using the CPS FOIA Center. 

Track the issue status and respond at: https://cps.mycusthelp.com/WEBAPP//_rs/RequestEdit.aspx?rid=16959

Non-Commercial FOIA Request :: N016959-021325
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 
03/03/2025 
Miriam Bhimani 
Dear Miriam Bhimani: 
RE: Chicago Public Schools FOIA Request N016959-021325 
Thank you for using the Chicago Public Schools FOIA Center. You requested the following: 
To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records: 

A log of all emails to/from the CPS Board Member, Debby Pope, from January 1, 2025 - January 31, 2025. 

1. Please search all CPS email accounts as well as personal accounts used for public business. The log should include but not be limited to: sender, recipient(s), date and time, subject line, and attachment. 

This request is made on behalf of The FOIA Bakery. Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Miriam Bhimani 

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fchicago-public-schools-3121%252Fboard-governance-debby-pope-emails-january-2025-181473%252F%253F&url_auth_token=AAATZ164Jy60iQjs6iHTUOyYGcc%3A1tioYu%3AeOFc-ho6BylDJx7nBtiMFJ2pxD6nMd2MeI_75b6QCkw 
RESPONSE: Documents responsive to your request are available to download via the CPS FOIA Center at www.cps.edu/FOIARequests . Please log in with your username and password to access the records. Please note that certain private information (personal email addresses, cell phone numbers, etc.) was redacted pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7. Specifically, section 7(1)(b) which exempts certain private information as defined by section 2(c-5) and section 7(1)(c) which exempts personal information contained within public records, the disclosure of which would constitute a clearly unwarranted invasion of personal privacy, unless the disclosure is consented to in writing by the individual subject of the information. “Unwarranted invasion of personal privacy” means the disclosure of information that is highly personal or objectionable to a reasonable person and in which the subject’s right to privacy outweighs any legitimate public interest in obtaining the information. Student/parent information has been redacted pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7.5 (r) which exempts from inspection or copying information prohibited from being disclosed by the Illinois School Student Records Act (ISSRA). ISSRA generally prohibits the disclosure of “school student records” and defines a “school student record” as “any writing or other recorded information concerning a student and by which a student may be individually identified, maintained by a school or at is direction or by an employee of a school, regardless of how or where the information is stored.” (105 ILCS 10/2(d). 
You have a right to have the denial of your request reviewed by the Public Access Counselor (PAC) at the Office of the Illinois Attorney General. 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a). You can file your Request for Review with the PAC by writing to: Leah Bartelt; Public Access Counselor Office of the Attorney General 500 South 2nd Street Springfield, Illinois 62706 E-mail: public.access@ilag.gov 877-299-3642 You also have the right to seek judicial review of your denial by filing a lawsuit in the State circuit court. 5 ILCS 140/11. If you choose to file a Request for Review with the PAC, you must do so within 60 calendar days of the date of this denial letter. 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a). Please note that you must include a copy of your original FOIA request and this denial letter when filing a Request for Review with the PAC. Sincerely, Patricia Majchrowicz Freedom of Information Act Officer Chicago Public Schools

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Hello, 

I am asking for records related to the replacement, relocation, and repair of ALPR cameras. 

Please include copies of invoices related to the replacement, relocation, and repair of ALPR cameras and related accessories. Copies should be in .csv format if possible, otherwise related in digital form. 

Include locations of the reinstalled or fixed ALPRs. 

Please search 2019 to today's date.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joey Scott

title: Request to Army Office of Public Affairs for all annual financial reports

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Request to Army Office of Public Affairs for all annual financial reports
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All annual financial reports for the US Army's Public Affairs office within the office's records retention schedule.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation. These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Untitled
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all document, list, registry, memoranda related to tracking, investigating, and analyzing AHI (Anomalous Health Incidents) and "Havana Syndrome" among the US population.

It is public knowledge that AHI and Havana Syndrome are tracked in the AHI Registry, but it is limited to federal employees and their dependents only: https://www.gao.gov/products/gao-24-106593

The purpose of this FOIA request is to access  any and all documents, lists, registry, memoranda dated January 1,  2018 to November 1, 2024 produced by and circulated within CDC related to tracking , investigating, and analyzing AHI and Havana Syndrome in both federal employees and their dependents, and in civilian adults and children.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Leonid Ber

communications.subject: RE: CDC FOIA Request #25-00184-FOIA
communications.communication:
Dear Dr.Ber,

It was a pleasure to speak with you today. Thank you for clarifying the scope of your request to the following scope:


  1.  Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records: Any and all document, list, registry, memoranda related to tracking, investigating, and analyzing AHI (Anomalous Health Incidents) and ‘Havana Syndrome’ among the US population, which involves the United States (U.S.) residents with domestic incidents on U.S. soil.


  1.  The purpose of this FOIA request is to access any and all CDC documents, lists, registry, memoranda dated January 1, 2018 to November 1, 2024 produced by and circulated within CDC related to tracking , investigating, and analyzing AHI and Havana Syndrome among the US population, which involves the United States (U.S.) residents with domestic incidents on U.S. soil.


You suggested that the “incidents” listed above may be listed as non-kinetic directed electromagnetic pulse energy weapon.

Please review the above clarification scope and let us know if you agree to the above clarification scope.

I look forward to receiving your response.
Best regards,

Leigh

title: Operation Payback

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Operation Payback
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Files mentioning "Operation Payback" or "Operation Avenge Assange," a series of cyber campaigns and attacks by the hacker collective Anonymous, which resulted in cyber attacks on PayPal, PostFinance, EveryDNS, the website of U.S. Senator Joe Lieberman, as well as Visa and Mastercard.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Emma Best

communications.communication:
# Individual Information

Prefix First Name Middle Name Last Name Suffix Email Phone Location

# Domestic Address

Address Line 1 Address Line 2 City State Postal

# Agreement to Pay

How you will pay

I am requesting a fee waiver for my request and have reviewed the FOIA
reference guide. If my fee waiver is denied, I would like to limit my request
to the two free hours of searching and 100 duplicated pages.

# Proof Of Affiliation for Fee Waiver

Waiver Explanation

    
    
    As my primary purpose is to inform about government activities by reporting
    on
    it and making the raw data available, I request that fees be waived.

Documentation Files

# Non-Individual FOIA Request

Request Information

    
    
    To Whom It May Concern:
    
    Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following
    records:
    
    Files mentioning "Operation Payback" or "Operation Avenge Assange," a series
    of cyber campaigns and attacks by the hacker collective Anonymous, which
    resulted in cyber attacks on PayPal, PostFinance, EveryDNS, the website of
    U.S. Senator Joe Lieberman, as well as Visa and Mastercard.
    
    The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and
    this request is not being made for commercial purposes.
    
    In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me
    of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the
    request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM
    if not.
    
    Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look
    forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days,
    as the statute requires.
    
    Sincerely,
    
    Emma Best
    
    Attachments:
    
    
    https://cdn.muckrock.com/outbound_composer_attachments/TheEmmaBest/65552/FBI20fee20category20and20search20parameters.pdf
    Upload documents directly:
    https://www.muckrock.com/accounts/agency_login/federal-bureau-of-investigation-10/operation-payback-66571/?uuid-login=3dff9bcd-01c7-44a5-8e56-13326a245a68&email=efoia%40subscriptions.fbi.gov#agency-reply

** 

Please be advised that efoia@subscriptions.fbi.gov is a no-reply email
address. Questions regarding your FOIA request may be directed to
foipaquestions@fbi.gov. If you have received a FOIPA request number, please
include this in all correspondence concerning your request. Please note eFOIPA
requests are processed in the order that they are received. If you have not
received a FOIPA request number, your request is in the process of being
opened at which time it will be assigned a FOIPA request number and
correspondence will be forthcoming.

** 

Upon receipt of your FOIPA request number, you may check the status of your
FOIPA request on the FBI’s electronic FOIA Library (The Vault) on the FBI’s
public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the ‘Check Status of Your
FOI/PA Request tool’ link. Status updates are performed on a weekly basis. If
you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: Operation Payback
communications.communication: If we limit the scope to exclude court filings, about how many pages would we be looking at?

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: Operation Payback
communications.communication:
Thank you for considering narrowing the scope of your request.  Your email will be forwarded to our negotiation team and a representative will be in contact.  Please allow 2-3 weeks for this initial contact.

Respectfully,

Public Information Officer
Record/Information Dissemination Section (RIDS) FBI-Information Management Division
170 Marcel Drive, Winchester, VA 22602-4843
Direct: (540) 868-4593
Fax: (540) 868-4391
Questions E-mail: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

Note:  This is a non-emergency email address.  If this is an emergency, please call 911 directly.  If you need to report a tip for immediate action, please contact FBI Tips at http://tips.fbi.gov/ or reach out to your local field office.

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1425709-000
communications.communication: Wow, you don't do ANYTHING in the statutory time limits, do you?

communications.subject: FW: Freedom of Information Act Request: Operation Payback
communications.communication:
Good morning Ms. Best,

The Public Information Officer indicated that you would be interested in eliminating the court documents from this request. Doing so would remove approximately 1685 pages. There are approximately 18,649 potentially responsive pages, so removing the court documents alone wouldn't be enough to move the request from the extra-large track (> 8,000 pages). We would be happy to make this reduction for you, but would ask that you consider making a further reduction to move the request into one of the faster tracks. Would you possibly be willing to reduce the request to up to 950 pages to move the request into the medium track? You are always welcome to request additional material once a release has been made. We could take the first 950 pages, the last 950, or split between the beginning and end of the file if you would like.

Please let us know how you would like to move forward.

Best regards,

FBI FOIA Negotiation Team
Information Management Division
fbi.foipa.negotiation@fbi.gov<mailto:fbi.foipa.negotiation@fbi.gov>
540-868-1695

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1425709-000
communications.communication:
>Would you possibly be willing to reduce the request to up to 950 pages to move the request into the medium track? You are always welcome to request additional material once a release has been made. We could take the first 950 pages, the last 950, or split between the beginning and end of the file if you would like.

No. What if we exclude chat logs submitted as discovery, in addition to court filings?

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1425709-000
communications.communication:
Good afternoon Ms. Best,

Apologies for the delayed response. Removing the chat logs takes out another 175 pages. Please let us know how you'd like to proceed.

Best regards,

FBI FOIA Negotiation Team
Information Management Division
fbi.foipa.negotiation@fbi.gov<mailto:fbi.foipa.negotiation@fbi.gov>
540-868-1695

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1425709-000
communications.communication: Let's omit the court records but keep everything else. I believe that will eliminate ~1,685 pages from the ~18,649 potentially responsive pages, leaving ~16,964 potentially responsive pages to be processed which would place the request in the extra-large track.

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1425709-000
communications.communication:
Good afternoon Ms. Best,

We can certainly do that. We'll eliminate the court documents and go forward with the remaining material for approximately 16,956 pages.

Best regards,

FBI FOIA Negotiation Team
Information Management Division
fbi.foipa.negotiation@fbi.gov<mailto:fbi.foipa.negotiation@fbi.gov>
540-868-1695

communications.subject: FW: Freedom of Information Act Request #1425709-000
communications.communication:
Good morning Ms. Best,

There are a couple of items to address before we can move forward with processing this request. First, we have a revised total for the court documents -  1789 pages, rather than 1685 pages. Also, we need to have an agreement from you to pay for the remaining pages before we proceed. The total, should all the remaining pages be released is now $505 (34 CDs at $15 each, less $5 credit for the first CD). This is an estimate; some information may not be responsive to your subject, while some may be withheld in full pursuant to FOIA/Privacy Act exemptions. Actual charges could be less, so no payment is due at this time. Payment information will be included with your release letter.

Best regards,

FBI FOIA Negotiation Team
Information Management Division
fbi.foipa.negotiation@fbi.gov<mailto:fbi.foipa.negotiation@fbi.gov>
540-868-1695

communications.subject: FW: Freedom of Information Act Request #1425709-000
communications.communication:
Good morning Ms. Best,

We hadn't heard back from you and wanted to follow up. As mentioned previously, we are unable to move forward with the processing of this request without confirmation of payment.

Best regards,

FBI FOIA Negotiation Team
Information Management Division
fbi.foipa.negotiation@fbi.gov<mailto:fbi.foipa.negotiation@fbi.gov>
540-868-1695

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1425709-000
communications.communication:
You should receive payment soon. Thank you for your patience. I understand it must be difficult to have to wait an entire week. 

I've been waiting over nine months. All but the last week was due to delays by your office. For instance, you ask me a question, I respond that day, four days later you tell me to "allow 2-3 weeks" for an initial response. I appreciate your diligence in following up, but thought you might want some perspective on the delays at play.

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1425709-000
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Best,

I believe there's been a misunderstanding. We only need you to agree to charges up to $505. No payment is owed at this time. Do we understand correctly that you agree to pay up to $505 for processing this request? As mentioned previously, this is an estimate; some information may not be responsive to your subject, while some may be withheld in full pursuant to FOIA/Privacy Act exemptions. Actual charges could be less, so no payment is due at this time. Payment information will be included with your release letter.

Best regards,

FBI FOIA Negotiation Team
Information Management Division
fbi.foipa.negotiation@fbi.gov<mailto:fbi.foipa.negotiation@fbi.gov>
540-868-1695

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1425709-000
communications.communication:
And now I have egg on my face.

I absolutely misread the message. Some agencies (especially those I don't have a history with) require 50% up front. When I scrolled up and skimmed the message... I apologize, and thank you for clarifying.

Yes, I agree to pay up to $505 in duplication fees for this request. 

If, in the review process, å new way to reduce the scope occurs the analyst processing it (saving time for them and money for me), I'm happy to consider it.

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1425709-000
communications.communication:
Good morning Ms. Best,

No worries, sometimes we misunderstand each other. All is well and thanks for the clarification. We’ll go ahead and make the current reduction, removing the court documents and if there are any other reductions that seem sensible when the request is being processed, we’ll give you a shout and figure that out at the time.

You should receive a letter from us in the next week or so confirming the removal of the court documents.

Thanks again and best regards,

FBI FOIA Negotiation Team
Information Management Division
fbi.foipa.negotiation@fbi.gov<mailto:fbi.foipa.negotiation@fbi.gov>
540-868-1695

communications.subject: FOIA 1425709-000
communications.communication:
Good Afternoon,


The PDFs have been re-uploaded and are now available.  You should have received an email with links for the documents regarding correspondence mailed May 28, 2024.


Public Information Officer
FBI - Information Management Division
200 Constitution Drive
Winchester, VA  22602
O: (540) 868-4593
E: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

Note:  This is a non-emergency email address.  If this is an emergency, please call 911 directly.  If you need to report a tip for immediate action, please contact FBI Tips at http://tips.fbi.gov/ or reach out to your local field office.

communications.subject: FOIA 1425709-000
communications.communication:
Good morning,

We are following up to see if you received the release for FOIA 1425709-000 Operation Payback that was re-uploaded and sent to you on September 11, 2024. As advised in the correspondence fees are owed.

Public Information Officer
FBI - Information Management Division
200 Constitution Drive
Winchester, VA  22602
O: (540) 868-4593
E: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

title: Student Assignment: Tarantula File, SY24 + SY25

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Student Assignment: Tarantula File, SY24 + SY25
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting a copy of the tarantula file.

Please provide this file for SY 2023-2024 and 2024-2025. This is the file that shows whether a school has an attendance boundary, how many students attend the school, how many students reside in the boundary, how many reside in the boundary and attend the school, how many attend but don't reside, how many reside but don't attend, , etc.

This request is made on behalf of The FOIA Bakery. Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Miriam Bhimani

Chicago Public Schools (CPS) responds to all public records requests in accordance with the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq. 
Due to the volume and complexity of requests received in the normal course of business, CPS is extending the time for its initial response to your request by an additional 5 business days (to 10 business days total beginning on the first business day following receipt of the request) pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/3(e)(v) which allows for the examination and evaluation of the requested records by personnel to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of Illinois FOIA or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions. 
Upon the completion of a response, CPS will provide the first 50 pages to you at no charge.  If a response is more than 50 pages, a fee of 15¢ per page will be charged for each additional page. All applicable fees must be paid prior to the copying. CPS will inform you of any fees due if your paper response exceeds 50 pages. You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you’ll receive an email when your request has been completed. Thank you for using the CPS FOIA Center.

title: Communications concerning Enhanced Library Card

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Communications concerning Enhanced Library Card
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all communications concerning the El Paso Public Library's Enhanced Library Card program between employees of the City of El Paso and federal agencies, including but not limited to Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) and Border Patrol. This request should not be understood to be seeking personally identifiable information of ID holders. The date range for this request is from Oct. 1, 2024, to the present.

Please include any relevant emails, memos, reports, or other forms of communication that pertain to this matter.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Cory Dawson

files.title: W171168_Clarification_Letter
files.source: El Paso City Attorney, El Paso, TX

communications.subject: RE: Texas Public Information Act Request #W171168-020525
communications.communication:
Dear Jacqueline Leyva, 

Thank you for seeking clarification of this request. The goal of this request is to ascertain if and how authorities have accessed information from the City of El Paso's database of Enhanced Library Card holders in recent months. 

To that end, it's not necessary to search all city employees emails. Rather to fulfill the request conducting a search only of the employees emails who have access to the database and their superiors should suffice, which would likely include a small number of library employees and perhaps a small number of city IT employees, as well as city leadership to include the city attorney Karla Nieman, library director Norma Martinez, and mayor Renard U. Johnson who may have been alerted to or approved/denied such access. I'm unable to name all employees who may access to the database of Enhanced Library Card holders as I do not have an exhaustive city employee directory but I hope this clarification helps identify where responsive records may be. 

Please let me know if further clarification is needed. Thank you again for your attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, 
Cory Dawson

communications.subject: Open Records Request :: W171168-020525
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

Good afternoon, 
I am in receipt of your email from 2/11/2025.  I reached out to the Library and IT department to find out who were those employees that work with the database of the Enhanced Library card. They both have gotten back to me and as per Library, there was only one person, Conrad Orozco and as per the IT Director, she stated no one in her IT Department has access to that database. 
Please advise if you still would like to include all Library and IT employees.  Additionally, IT will be searching those that you named specifically to include, the city attorney Karla Nieman, library director Norma Martinez, and mayor Renard U. Johnson.  Please follow the link to the Leadership Organization Chart to see if there are others email boxes you would like to be searched: PowerPoint Presentation 
Once all this is clarified, your request will be processed. 
Sincerely, 
Jackie

communications.subject: RE: Texas Public Information Act Request #W171168-020525
communications.communication:
Thank you for your continued work on this. In that case searches only of the city attorney Karla Nieman, library director Norma Martinez, and mayor Renard U. Johnson along with Conrad Orozco will suffice for this request, no need to expand to all Library and IT employees. Thank you again and please don't hesitate to reach out should you have further questions or clarifications. 

Best,
Cory Dawson

Jackie

title: FWS drone footage and materials from flights in Neal Smith National Wildlife Refuge

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FWS drone footage and materials from flights in Neal Smith National Wildlife Refuge
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting images, video, digital orthophotos, panoramic images and 3D models created in drone flyovers of the Neal Smith National Wildlife Refuge in August 2019.

This mission was disclosed in a log of unmanned aerial vehicle missions released via a previous FOIA request. The remote pilots in command are listed as Teague Mercer and R. Allen Gilbert Jr.  The log says that "Video or still images, Digital Orthophoto, DEM" were collected for "Multi-spectral mapping" and a "panoramic image of bison enclosure."

I ask that all of the assets gathered be released.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ben Welsh

communications.subject: Re: [EXTERNAL] Freedom of Information Act Request: FWS drone footage and materials from flights in Neal Smith National Wildlife Refuge
communications.communication:
It appears you are seeking to make a FOIA request, but you sent your request via email rather than using one of the written forms of submission listed on the Department’s FOIA website, https://www.doi.gov/foia,  or utilizing physical or facsimile addresses of an appropriate FOIA contact, located at https://www.doi.gov/foia/contacts.  Per our regulations, your request cannot be processed until you resubmit it utilizing one of the written forms of submission noted above.   See 43 C.F.R. § 2.3(b).



We've transitioned to FOIA Online https://foiaonline.gov/foiaonline/action/public/home, and recommend requesters create an account on FOIA Online. This allows requesters to track progress, search other FOIA request, access related released records and more.



If you have any questions about our response you may contact Matt Sullivan or Stacey Cummins, by email at fwhq_foia@fws.gov<mailto:fwhq_foia@fws.gov>.


United States Fish and Wildlife Service
Headquarters Freedom of Information Act Office
MS: IRTM
5275 Leesburg Pike
Falls Church, VA 22041

title: Use of Illinois Arts Council funding for Evanston, IL

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Use of Illinois Arts Council funding for Evanston, IL
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

According to the National Endowment for The Arts (N.E.A.) grant search, the Illinois Arts Council (I.A.C.) receives annual grants from the N.E.A.. For the Grant Period 07/2024 - 12/2025 the NEA reports a grant of $1,146,200. 

This N.E.A. money funds I.A.C. programs in various capacities. It can be inferred, for example, that at the city level, some of this funding is provided to the City of Evanston through the Evanston Arts Council (E.A.C.). 

The specific breakdown of how these funds are divided up is not publicly available. The I.A.C. website instructs individuals to file a F.O.I.A. for cases where this information is desired. 

That said, I request all communication between the Illinois Arts Council and the City of Evanston (including the E.A.C.) regarding grant money from June 2024 to the time that this request is processed. 

Additionally, it would be greatly appreciated if you provided a detailed breakdown of N.E.A. funding allocated to the city of Evanston during this same time frame. 

If applicable, I request that fees be waived as documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sol Thomas

communications.subject: FW: [External] Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Use of Illinois Arts Council funding for Evanston, IL
communications.communication:
March 3, 2025

Sol Thomas
MuckRock News
DEPT MR 181955
263 Huntington Ave
Boston, MA 02115
Email: 181955-78074712@requests.muckrock.com<mailto:181955-78074712@requests.muckrock.com>

RE:        Freedom of Information Act Request #03-03-2025

Dear Sol Thomas:

Thank you for writing to the Illinois Arts Council (IAC) with your request for information pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) (5 ILCS 140/1 et seq. (West 2018)).  In an E-Mail dated Sunday, February 23, 2025, and received by this agency on Monday, February 24, 2025, you requested:

1)  all National Endowment for the Arts funds from the IAC to:


  1.  The City of Evanston (including the Evanston Art Center/E.A.C.) regarding grant money from June 2024 to the time that this request is processed; and

2) all email correspondence in relation to these grants with

             a) The City of Evanston (including the E.A.C.)

Attached please find the files responsive to your request:


  1.  List of Grants to the Evanston Art Center.xlsx
  2.  FOIA Email Chain.pdf

The information responsive to your request is attached in its entirety.  If this is not the information that you are requesting, please let us know and perhaps we can further assist you. If you should have any questions, please contact me at george.tarasuk@illinois.gov.

Very truly yours,

George Tarasuk
FOIA Officer
Illinois Arts Council (IAC)

title: Pennsylvania Executive Order on "Scandalous or Disagraceful Conduct" (Pennsylvania Public Utilities Commission)

communications.subject: Pennsylvania Right to Know Act Request: Pennsylvania Executive Order on "Scandalous or Disagraceful Conduct" (Pennsylvania Public Utilities Commission)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Pennsylvania Right to Know Act, I hereby request the following records:

For purposes of this request, "SCANDALOUS OR DISGRACEFUL CONDUCT POLICY" means any of: (a) Executive Order No. 1980-18 Amended, dated May 6, 2024, 54 Pa.B. 3018; (b) 4 Pa. Code §  7.158.1 ("Personal conduct," providing that "No employee, appointee or official of the Executive Branch of the Commonwealth may engage in scandalous or disgraceful conduct, or any other behavior, on or off duty, which may bring the service of the Commonwealth into disrepute") or (c) any policy, guidance, regulation, or other prohibition against "scandalous or disgraceful conduct, or any other behavior, on or off duty, which may bring the service of the Commonwealth into disrepute."

1. Any records reflecting a complaint, charge, or disciplinary action concerning any violation (or alleged violation) of a SCANDALOUS OR DISGRACEFUL CONDUCT POLICY.

2. Any records reflecting any warning issued to any employee concerning the SCANDALOUS OR DISGRACEFUL CONDUCT POLICY.

3. Any policy, guidance, regulation, or handbook concerning the SCANDALOUS OR DISGRACEFUL CONDUCT POLICY.

This request is limited to records generated on or after May 5, 2024.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

title: 2021 Shooting of Halyna Hutchins

communications.subject: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: 2021 Shooting of Halyna Hutchins
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am looking for all records available in the shooting death of Halyna Hutchins on set of the film "Rust". Medical examiners report, autopsy, police reports - would be appreciated.

Thank you.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dawn Gandhi

communications.subject: FW: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: 2021 Shooting of Halyna Hutchins
communications.communication:
Good Afternoon,

I will be completing your request for records regarding the case of Halayna Hutchins death investigation.

The Santa Fe County Sheriff’s Office has created a Dropbox with all evidence related to case: SFSO 2021007949

Can you please provide me with an email address that you will use to access the files via Santa Fe County Sheriff’s Office Dropbox? Once you have provided that information, I will add you to the list to gain access and send you the link you will need.

Thank you,

If you have any questions, please let me know.


Denise Womack Avila
Denise Womack Avila
SFSO PIO/ Media Coordinator
505-986-2434

Your Dropbox account password was recently reset.

While we've updated your password, any computers or phones that you previously linked to your Dropbox account are still connected. You can disconnect a lost or stolen device from your account settings.[1]

If you changed your password for security reasons, we strongly recommend that you unlink any devices, web sessions, or apps that look unfamiliar or that you're concerned about. See this Help Center article[2] for more information.

If you didn't make this change, please let us know[3] .

Thanks!
- The Dropbox Team

communications.subject: (2/9) Sharing is caring
communications.communication:
Learn how to share with Dropbox ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 
‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌

<https://www.dropbox.com/?oref=e&_tk=email&_camp=8862324&_ad=db19ac4fec2a4fd48ade7bfe48b8de42&utm_source=iter&utm_medium=email&utm_term=us-en&utm_campaign=p1_bb_co_all_pcn_b202111&utm_content=h_l>
 
<https://www.dropbox.com/?oref=e&_tk=email&_camp=8862324&_ad=db19ac4fec2a4fd48ade7bfe48b8de42&utm_source=iter&utm_medium=email&utm_term=us-en&utm_campaign=p1_bb_co_all_pcn_b202111&utm_content=h_l>

Share any file or folder easily, with anyone 
By just sharing a link, you can send anything – from Office Docs and PDFs to 
zipped folders and large CAD files – to anyone, even if they don’t have a 
Dropbox account. Add password protection and expiration dates to ensure only 
the right people see your files.*

Big needs? With Dropbox Transfer, you can send large files up to 100 GB 
without taking up space in your Dropbox account.** 





Learn More 
<https://learn.dropbox.com/self-guided-learning/dropbox-fundamentals-course/how-to-use-dropbox#how-to-share-a-file-or-folder-from-your-dropbox-account>
 
<https://learn.dropbox.com/self-guided-learning/dropbox-fundamentals-course/how-to-use-dropbox#how-to-share-a-file-or-folder-from-your-dropbox-account>




Share what you want, how you want 
You can save, access, and share your important stuff from anywhere, at any 
time, on any device. 

Start sharing <https://www.dropbox.com/work?file_chooser_type=sharing> 

 <https://www.dropbox.com/work?file_chooser_type=sharing> 



All of your large file transfer needs covered 
Dropbox Transfer lets you send up to 2 GB per transfer with your Dropbox Basic 
plan, up to 100 GB with Dropbox Essentials and Dropbox Business and up to 250 
GB with Dropbox Business Plus. Send videos, project files, and track downloads. 

Create a transfer <https://www.dropbox.com/transfer> 

 <https://www.dropbox.com/transfer> 

*Some features require upgrading your account to a paid Dropbox plan.
Learn how and view plans. <https://www.dropbox.com/plans> 
**The size limit of your transfer depends on the plan you have. Click for more 
information. <https://help.dropbox.com/share/dropbox-transfer>

<https://www.youtube.com/user/dropbox>
